posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.52 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Reminder, if you are using Obtanium for betas to opt-in for pre-release tags.

Complete list of new commits since 7.51.2:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.51.2…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta Feedback for the upcoming Android 7.51 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.52.0 (156900)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

29 new commits since 7.51.2:

Show commits

  • Clear auth credentials post restore and when a user disables backups. [1]

  • Add search functionality to debug log screen. [2]

  • Disable current tier from being selected. [3]

  • Fix identity key update failure when profile key verification failed. [4]

  • Add device linking infrastructure. [5]

  • Add developer only crude link device UX. [6]

  • Add initial SVRB support. [7]

  • Remove legacy attachment fields from Backup.proto [8]

  • Add unit tests for FindByViewModel. [9]

    Closes #14145

  • Update to latest backup tests. [10]

  • Make our loggers singletons. [11]

  • Cancel may have messages notification from FcmJobService. [12]

  • Add additional logging around JobManager memory state. [13]

  • Add missing unmockk calls in various unit tests. [14]

  • Add filter functionality to debug log screen. [15]

  • Avoid reallocation inserting logs into database [16]

  • Swap between two log buffers to save on copying [17]

  • Add specific registration error cases for SVRB. [18]

  • Remove plaintext device creation timestamp. [19]

  • Save media attachments to Signal subdirectories. [20]

    Closes #14277

  • Add Out of Remote Storage sheet. [21]

  • Fix redemption error details. [22]

  • Add rudimentary link+sync support. [23]

  • Add Glide Downsampler. [24]

  • Utilize the correct method for converting signal service amount to fiat money. [25]

  • Add more linked device checks to various jobs. [26]

  • Add remote config to split libsignal-net support for standard vs proxied. [27]

  • Update translations and other static files. [28]

  • Bump version to 7.52.0 [29]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.51.2…v7.52.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.cooked:
TLDR: video of 1:12 shared as story, only first 30 s a shared. Then from this story reshared as another story ⇒ full 1:12 video is there (as 3 stories).

Very funny bug.

I shared a 1 minute 12 second video that I had recorded with my old Samsung phone (S9) to a Signal group story, and to two other story-contact-collections.

Signal told me: the video will be split into pieces of 30 seconds.

Ok.

Then I checked. Oh, only ONE video of only 30 seconds was sent. Hm.

I thought: well, at least part of the video is shared. But then decided to reshare one of that story videos to another collection of contacts as a story.

And to my surprise: it was all three parts of the video that this new recipient has received (or was sent to). How??

I then did this to the original receivers (reshared the one video story), and voilà: all three videos were sent.

Crazy. That means the video was still hidden somewhere in that one single story. And by only sharing this one video story (which in theory can’t be longer than 30 seconds) the whole 1:12 video was shared in three pieces.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.52.0/42d33de5c5d4cc074c5f18f4ea9f272a4a912865b0825fe3fdd30ba3bb0a5ee6

posts.cooked: The 7.52.1 release is deleted from GitHub releases

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked: The 7.52.1 Beta available in Google Play Store.
Why was it deleted from GitHub releases anyway?

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
Still there. They forgot to push the Release button for download.

GitHub

Release v7.52.1 · signalapp/Signal-Android

Tagging 7.52.1 for release.

Screenshot

Screenshot_20250810_1553311260×2800 186 KB

I see the change log mentioning faster scroll performance in long chats. I didn’t notice any obvious difference in my multi-year chats.

Am I missing something? It seems like I still have to continuously swipe down, down, down to go further back in the chat.

Any possibility of adding scroll bars that could be grabbed and bring you all the way back to the top of the chat in one drag from bottom to top of screen, or anywhere in the middle? And then use normal swipes to fine tune where you need to be?

Just use the search inside the chat. Then select a date below the search field. Voilà.

Btw scrolling is definitively faster in long chats on my old Samsung S9 phone. No more lag.

Bug

This selecting of a date in long old chats is now suuuuper slow and laggy. Wasn’t that slow before (when I last time used it … some time ago). Wow, it is that slow, that Signal stops working if I go back three years. Can’t create a debug log yet.

Yeah finally managed to finish the search (just wait 10 to 20 seconds). And here the debug log:

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.52.0/f4906fbe78027e6c868bcfc831be34599bb7ead5e0fe35cbd2feb3efb417cfeb

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
erik55:

TLDR: video of 1:12 shared as story, only first 30 s a shared. Then from this story reshared as another story ⇒ full 1:12 video is there (as 3 stories).

Tracking. You’ve found an interesting twist to this bug.

princeofpersia:

The 7.52.1 release is deleted from GitHub releases

chiwaijm:

The 7.52.1 Beta available in Google Play Store.

princeofpersia:

Why was it deleted from GitHub releases anyway?

chiwaijm:

Still there. They forgot to push the Release button for download.

I indeed forgot. It’s building now.

HappySignalUser:

It seems like I still have to continuously swipe down, down, down to go further back in the chat.

The rate at which you scroll per flick hasn’t changed, it should just be smoother /less janky.

erik55:

Btw scrolling is definitively faster in long chats on my old Samsung S9 phone. No more lag.

erik55:

This selecting of a date in long old chats is now suuuuper slow and laggy.

Tracking.

posts.cooked:
Never got a notification for the message with ID 1754982080672, it was just there when I opened the app about a half hour later. The received time is listed as two seconds after the sent time.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.52.2/9d5f1f4750be00dacda754158c7b96aa11e676d1f13af29baf84f1a5638e1f34

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.53 release.
